content.rendered:
2023 World Cup Venues for Rugby

The 2023 World Cup will be hosted by nine cities across the fascinating country of France. The 51-day tournament will include 48 matches in world class cities like Paris, Lyon, Marseille and Nice, each offering a different experiences for visitors.

The highlight of the 2023 World Cup will be the final match, which will play out at Stade de France in Paris. Built for the 1998 World Cup, the Stade de France boasts a capacity for 80,698 fans, and has been a regular host to numerous sporting events, including the World Cups of both soccer and rugby. As France’s national stadium, it is home to France’s national team and will welcome World Cup fans to four group stage matches, two quarterfinal matches, and holds the honor of hosting both semi-finals, the third-place match, and the 2023 World Cup Final match.
